intro: Oreopanax obtusilobus, commonly known as the blunt-lobed oreopanax, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Araceae family, which includes plants such as philodendrons and calla lilies. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that are often lobed and have a leathery texture. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spadices, a common feature among arum family members. Oreopanax obtusilobus is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and understory habitats.
